entry.title: BackdoorCTF'23 Writeups
entry.summary:
I’m sharing writeups for the challenges I created for Backdoor CTF’23, hosted by InfoSecIITR. Here they are :-
Forensics/Headache
Description:- I’ve had a headache since last evening. Is there a magic spell that can cure it immediately?
Challenge File: file
This challenge was beginner level forensics challenge. A png image is given as the challenge file, which seems to be corrupted. As th...

entry.title: Networking - Part 2
entry.summary:
Welcome to the other part of Computer Networking. In this part, we’ll be exploring the protocols involved in networking.
HTTP
HTTP stands for Hypertext Tranfer Protocol. It can be defined as the foundation of communication on the web. It is an application layer protocol, used to transfer information between devices. This protocol involves various request methods and corresponding responses to...

entry.title: Networking - Part 1
entry.summary:
Hey everyone! This blog covers the basics of computer networking. So let’s start with the fundamental question… Exactly what is a computer network? It’s a network of two or more two devices exchanging information and data. Let’s understand this statement with the working of multiple devices connected to a router.
Most of us have routers at our homes, and multiple devices (like laptops, smartph...

entry.title: CSAW'23 Quals
entry.summary:
I had the privilege of participating in the CSAW’23 Quals CTF as a member of InfosecIITR, and it proved to be a great experience. I am delighted to share the writeups for the reversing challenges my team and I successfully solved during the competition.

entry.title: SekaiCTF 2023 - DEFCON Invitation
entry.summary:
Description:- As you all know, DEF CON CTF Qualifier 2023 was really competitive and we didn’t make it. Surprisingly, 2 months before the finals in Las Vegas, we received an official invitation from Nautilus Institute to attend the event. Should we accept the invitation and schedule the trip?
